1.description: First, create the blade, which will serve as the primary functional element of the object, providing the sharp edge necessary for cutting or slicing. This blade will be positioned prominently at the front of the object, establishing the overall shape and purpose while setting the foundation for the subsequent components that will enhance its usability and performance.

2.description: Next, add the bolster at the base of the blade, where it meets the handle, to provide additional strength and stability at this critical junction. This component not only reinforces the connection between the blade and handle but also enhances the overall balance of the knife, ensuring safer and more effective use.

3.description: Then, attach the guard just below the bolster, ensuring it extends outward to provide a protective barrier for the hand against accidental slips while using the knife. This addition not only enhances the safety of the user but also reinforces the structural integrity where the blade and handle converge, creating a seamless transition between these components.

4.description: Finally, add the handle to the lower portion of the bolster, securely connecting it to the guard and creating a comfortable grip for the user. This handle not only completes the knife's structure but also ensures that the user can effectively control the blade while providing stability and balance during use.
